checklist.title: Is the Android chat interface UI implementation complete?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code implements all essential UI components for a chat interface: RecyclerView with proper adapters, message bubble layouts (left/right alignment), user avatars, timestamps, and message status indicators. Score 0 if missing core UI components, 5 if basic implementation is present, and 10 if the interface includes sophisticated UI elements like bubble tails, read receipts, and proper padding based on Material Design guidelines.

checklist.title: Is the chat message alignment logic correctly implemented?
checklist.description: Verify if the code correctly positions messages on the right side for userId=1 (current user) and on the left for other users. Deduct 5 points if the alignment logic is incorrect or inconsistent. Check if message bubbles have appropriate styling differences (color, shape, padding) based on sender. Full score requires visual evidence of proper message alignment in screenshots.

checklist.title: Is the message recall handling implemented properly?
checklist.description: Assess how recalled messages (isRecalled=true) are displayed differently from regular messages. Verify if the UI shows 'Message recalled' text with appropriate styling. Check if the code handles recall state transitions. Deduct 5 points if recalled messages are not visually distinct, and 3 points if there's no support for recall status changes after loading.

checklist.title: Is the data pagination and loading mechanism implemented?
checklist.description: Evaluate if the code handles the pagination parameters (total, size, current, pages) from the JSON data. Check for implementation of pagination controls or infinite scrolling. Verify proper loading of additional message pages. Deduct 5 points if pagination is not implemented at all, and 3 points if loading indicators are missing during page transitions.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as empty messages, null avatar URLs, network issues, or JSON parsing errors) and provide friendly error prompts or recovery mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the experience (e.g., 1. Message reactions/emoji support 2. Voice message playback controls 3. Animated typing indicators 4. Smart date separators between message groups). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple view binding approaches coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to chat display (e.g., unnecessary analytics) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating UI/data/network layers), use of design patterns (Adapter, ViewHolder, etc.), and proper memory management. Deduct 5 points if global state pollution is found or if RecyclerView implementation is inefficient; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no ViewHolder pattern is used. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows Android Material Design principles: 1) Appropriate use of elevation and shadows for message bubbles 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8dp multiple principle) 3) Professional typography system (body text size ≥ 14sp, proper line height). Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for inconsistent styling, and 5 points for improper text wrapping or overflow. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the dynamic interaction smooth and seamless?
checklist.description: Judge whether the dynamic effects conform to human perception characteristics: 1) Smooth scrolling performance with proper view recycling 2) Message sending/loading animations between 300-500ms 3) Clear visual feedback for user actions. Deduct 5 points for each operation without feedback, 3 points for stuttering during fast scrolling, and 5 points for poor list item reuse implementation causing visual glitches. The full score is 10 points.
